title: The puffed-up Remainers in Parliament will not be able to block Brexit for much longer
text:
Perhaps today our Prime Minister, battered but not broken, is contemplating the words of the English theologian Thomas Fuller who in 1650 observed that:

“It is always darkest just before the day dawneth.”

It would be foolish not to concede that hardcore Remainers, opportunists, cynics and democracy deniers terrified of their own voters, scored a temporary tactical victory on Saturday.

At what cost however?

The voting public, with whom most of our MPs will have to collide at some stage and probably sooner rather than later, have moved from irritation to incomprehension to white hot burning anger at their antics. They can see in plain view the Commons shenanigans, the self-serving weasel words,...
